item.title: DuckDuckGo adds access to advanced models to it subscription plan

review.headline_rewrite: DuckDuckGo adds access to advanced models to it subscription plan
bullets: Privacy-focused consumer tech company DuckDuckGo launched a subscription plan last year that bundled a VPN service, personal information removal, and identity theft restoration.
The company said Thursday that the subscription now gives users access to the latest AI models through Duck.ai without paying extra.
The Duck.ai chatbot is free to use, and users get access to models like Anthropic’s Claude 3.5 Haiku, Meta’s Llama 4 Scout, Mistral AI’s Mistral Small 3 24B, and OpenAI’s GPT-4o mini.
With DuckDuckGo’s $9.99 per month plan, users will be able to access newer models, including OpenAI’s GPT-4o and GPT-5, Anthropic’s Claude Sonnet 4, and Meta’s Llama Maverick.
“These bigger models are better at following detailed instructions, maintaining context through extended chats, and delivering deeper, more nuanced responses.
The DuckDuckGo subscription offers a way to use some of these models, but with more privacy,” the company said in a post.

item.title: The Browser Company, maker of Arc and Dia, is being acquired

review.headline_rewrite: The Browser Company, maker of Arc and Dia, is being acquired
bullets: Now he’ll own the thing: Atlassian is acquiring The Browser Company, the New York-based startup that makes both Arc and the new AI-focused Dia browser.

The Browser Company, maker of Arc and Dia, is being acquired
Atlassian is paying $610 million for the company, in a big bet that both AI and browsers are key to the future of work.
Big companies require data privacy, security, and management features in the software they use, and The Browser Company didn’t offer enough of them.

Eventually, as companies everywhere raced to put AI at the center of their businesses, and as The Browser Company made its own bets in AI, Cannon-Brookes suggested maybe the companies were better off together.
The acquisition is mostly about Dia, which launched in June.
Open up three spreadsheets in three tabs and Dia can move data between them; log into your Gmail and Dia can tell you what’s next on the calendar.

item.title: This high-end Miele outdoor grill will cook for you

review.headline_rewrite: This high-end Miele outdoor grill will cook for you
bullets:
This high-end Miele outdoor grill will cook for you
The ‘Dreams’ exterior kitchen line is launching in Germany, Austria, and Switzerland next year.

“At the touch of a button, it heats up to the desired temperature within a few minutes and regulates the heat in its four grilling zones automatically, just like an oven,” Miele said in its press release.
That could remove some of the stress for folks who love to host meals and entertain friends and family outside, but you’ll still have to physically flip any burgers yourself.

Miele says the kitchen can be configured in a range of sizes to suit the available space, and that modules are available for a range of exterior appliances, including several gas grills and the company’s first outdoor refrigerator.
These outdoor kitchens are becoming popular luxury purchases in the US, so it’s a shame that it may take some time for it to launch in the states.
Miele didn’t provide launch pricing, but said that the Dreams range will be available in Germany, Austria, and Switzerland from spring 2026.

item.title: A Labubu Rave Offers a Salve for the Darkest Timeline

review.headline_rewrite: A Labubu Rave Offers a Salve for the Darkest Timeline
bullets: It’s a celebration of Labubu, the furry Ewok-like collectible that, in an age of fly-by-night TikTok trends, AI influencers, and cheap hype, seems to have become a bona fide phenomenon.
Outside, a line snakes through the parking lot, and soft hints of weed smoke perfume the balmy night air.
From his backpack he pulls a limited-edition Coca-Cola Labubu and delicately holds it as if it were a trophy, waiting for me to admire it.
Everyone from Rihanna, BTS, Kim Kardashian, and Naomi Osaka—who showed off four crystal-encrusted limited editions at this year’s US Open tournament—have sung the praise song of Labubu.
From a stage inside Catch One, a movie-theater-size LED screen plays animations of the furry toy deity, and the DJ summons his faithful.
Hands launch into the air.

item.title: DuckDuckGo's subscription now offers some of the latest chatbots from OpenAI and Anthropic

review.headline_rewrite: DuckDuckGo's subscription now offers some of the latest chatbots from OpenAI and Anthropic
bullets: Since the start of last summer, DuckDuckGo has offered a handful of AI chatbots from OpenAI, Anthropic and others directly through its browser.
And while it's mostly low-cost models like GPT-4o mini and Claude 3.5 Haiku on offer, the feature, Duck.ai, allows you to use those tools without sacrificing your privacy.
The price of the service — either $10 per month or $100 billed annually — remains unchanged, and you still get all the previous perks included in the package.

It's now simply known as the DuckDuckGo subscription, and, in addition to offering access to the company's own VPN, as well as its personal information removal and identity protection services, it allows you to use some of the latest models from OpenAI, Anthropic and Meta.
As before, any conversations you have with those chatbots through DuckDuckGo are anonymized and your data won't be used for training future systems.
"Today, we're expanding Duck.ai by giving DuckDuckGo subscribers access to more advanced AI models, covered by the same strong protections," said DuckDuckGo.
Read more about how we evaluate products.

For each VPN on this list, I've shared which platforms it works on, how much it cuts into your download speed, where it offers servers, what other features are included and how much the best available deal costs.
Every feature is where you expect it to be, never demanding any digging or leaving you perplexed about what a certain setting is for.
There's no drop-off in quality between platforms, either: Proton has clearly paid equally close attention to its clients for Windows, Mac, iOS and Android.
It's also a VPN uniquely devoted to security and privacy.
Not only did it pass my leak tests without a scratch, but it's also a leader in physical VPN security — its Secure Core servers connect you through locations fortified in the real-world.
